Welcome to mifcho’s documentation!¶

Contents:

Handlers¶

class mifcholib.handlers.HobsHandler(cm)¶

Accepts jobs in the form:

(conn, addr, (method, uri, status))
class mifcholib.handlers.ManagementHandler(cm)¶

Accepts jobs on the form:

(conn, address, request_line)
class mifcholib.handlers.PeerHandler(cm)¶

Accepts jobs on the form:

(conn, address, (method, uri, version))

class mifcholib.handlers.StaticWebHandler(path_prefix='')¶

Spit out static-files over http. Accepts jobs on the form:

(conn, address, (method, uri, version))
class mifcholib.handlers.TCPTunnelingHandler(cm)¶

Jobs on the form:

(connection, address, (peer_id, ep_host, ep_port))

Providing a peer_id will cause the tunneling to be routed through the peer identified by peer_id.

class mifcholib.handlers.WebsocketHandler(cm)¶
Handles (conn, address, data) jobs. Parses the communication based on the websocket draft 75

ConnectionManager¶

ConnectionManager

class mifcholib.cm.ConnectionManager(options)¶

Supplies helpers and maintains state for managing connections and tunnels.

add_tunnel(tunnel)¶
Add a tunnel.
connect(address, peer_id=None, use_tls=False)¶
Create a connection to address. Possible via another mifcho instance.
run()¶
Start the connectionmanager.
stop()¶
Shut down connection-manager.
teardown(conn)¶
Tear down a socket properly and remove it from the connection-manager.
class mifcholib.cm.Listener(cm, address, use_tls)¶

TCP Socket bind/listen/accept on address.

Wrap an accepted socket into a Connection and pass the connection off to a dispatcher based on matching in the routing map.

class mifcholib.cm.PerformanceCollector(sample_rate)¶

Collects performance measurements each ‘sample_rate’ seconds.

log()¶
Retrieve the collected data.

Connection¶

class mifcholib.connection.Connection(s, use_tls=False)¶

Wrapper around socket and OpenSSL.

classmethod fromaddress(address, use_tls=False)¶
Constructor-factory based on address = (host, port).
read_bytes(bytes_to_read)¶
Read ‘bytes_to_read’ amount of bytes.
readline(term='rn')¶
Read until end-of-line is reached or ‘term’ is read.
recv(length)¶
Receive ‘length’ bytes.
send(bytes)¶
Send ‘bytes’.

Connectors¶

Dispatchers¶

class mifcholib.dispatchers.Dispatcher(mapping)¶
Override dispatch() to implement the dispatching policy.
class mifcholib.dispatchers.HTTPDispatcher(mapping)¶
Spits the connection a matching handler based on the query-url.
class mifcholib.dispatchers.TCPDispatcher(mapping)¶
Spits the connection to the first available TCPHandler.

Messages¶

mifcholib.messages.end_headers(c)¶

Sends the carriage-return + line-feed to indicate end of headers.

Any send_request or send_response must be eventually followed by end_headers()

mifcholib.messages.get_headers(c)¶

Parse headers from incoming request/response

return dict header => value, eg. ‘Content-Length’ : ‘430’
mifcholib.messages.get_request(c)¶

Parse a request without body

return (method “string”, urlparse object, version “string”)
mifcholib.messages.get_request_line(c)¶

Parse request-line

return (method “string”, urlparse object, version “string”)
mifcholib.messages.get_response(c)¶

Parse status-line and headers of incoming response

return (version “string”, status “int”, reason “string”, headers “list of (header, value) tuples”)
mifcholib.messages.get_response_line(c)¶

Parse status-line

Return (version “string”, status “int”, reason “string”)
mifcholib.messages.send_header(c, keyword, value)¶

Send header:

send_header('Content-Length', 340) => "Content-Length: 340

“

mifcholib.messages.send_request(c, type='GET', url='/', version='HTTP/1.1', address=('localhost', 8080), headers=[])¶

Sends the request-line of a request and the obligatory host header

e.g. send_request(c, ‘GET’, ‘/’, ‘HTTP/1.1’, (‘localhost’, 8080))

mifcholib.messages.send_response(c, code, message=None, version='HTTP/1.1', headers=[])¶

Send a response without body

e.g. send_reponse(200, ‘OK’, ‘HTTP/1.1’) => “HTTP/1.1 200 OK

“

PeerInfo¶

Piper¶

class mifcholib.piper.Piper(cm, source, sink, buffer_size=1024, detach=False)¶
Pipes payloads between two sockets.

Tunnel¶

Thread Utilities¶

class mifcholib.threadutils.Worker(name)¶
A common interface for non-workpool threads.
class mifcholib.threadutils.Workpool(thread_name='', max_instances=4)¶

Basic workpool implementation, each thread polls a queue for jobs. Executing the work() method when retrieving a job from the queue.

Workpool interface: start/stop/order Override the work() method Optionally override the deallocate() method

deallocate()¶
Override this function to abort any blocking calls in the Handler.
order(work)¶
Place a job on the queue.
stop()¶
Stop the Workpool.
work(work)¶
Execute the actual work, override this method.

Websocket¶

mifcholib.ws.receive_message(c)¶

Receive a Web Socket frame and return its payload as unicode string.

Args:
request: mod_python request.
Raises:
ConnectionTerminatedException: when client already terminated.
